page.title: 02Silloth Trade _ Docks
page.content: The docks area is really where Silloth began. Some business-men in Carlisle thought that Silloth would be a most suitable place to build a port, so between{1854}and{1859 }the railway and docks were built. There are now two docks _ the{Marshall }(or outer) {Dock and the{New Dock}_ both medium in size and having a fair amount of trade. There are cattle sheds but this trade has now stopped.{Carr's Mill}is on the dockside. This produces good quality {flour and animal feeds, }and is doing well. There are 3 big silos containing {cement,}owned by{Harrison's.} There is regular trade with ships and lorries in general cargo. The railway is now closed. On the old marshalling yards there are now a few small factories. The rest of the area has been levelled and grassed for sports use.
